definition: to bear/to carry on one's back/to shoulder
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
debt as heavy as a mountain on a turtle's back

sentences.english: There is intense and deep-seated hatred to return a village afresh after the boy is grown.
sentences.chinese: 男孩长大后背负着血海深仇重新返回村庄。

sentences.english: Who cleanses away her sin burdened for several ages?
sentences.chinese: 又是谁，涤荡了背负几世的罪。

sentences.english: However, you should feel that it isnot your responsibility to take on this stress.
sentences.chinese: 不过，你应该明白自己并没有义务去背负这种重压。

sentences.english: You have the burden and the great joy of being outsiders.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个局外者，你虽然有所背负，但也很快乐。

sentences.english: And at your feet is a swath of ants bearing triangular bits of green leaf.
sentences.chinese: 在脚下，则有一长列蚂蚁背负着三角形的绿叶碎片。

sentences.english: But all three of them are saddled with debts they can’t possibly repay.
sentences.chinese: 但是这三个国家都背负了他们不可能还清的债务。
背负着俗世的浮尘和愧罪。

sentences.english: The country laboured under a massive debt burden.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家背负了巨额债务，痛不欲生。

sentences.english: When a man walks into a room, he brings his whole life with him.
sentences.chinese: 当一个男人选择安身立命，他背负着自己的一生。

sentences.english: These troops are armed with a large shield to protect them during the slow process of reloading their crossbow.
sentences.chinese: 巨盾弩兵背负全身巨盾，以防装填弩箭途中遭受攻击。

sentences.english: Although barely escape one's life however disaster and Chi Yu, bear the compensation of price having a day.
sentences.chinese: 虽死里逃生却殃及池鱼，背负起天价的赔偿。

sentences.english: But, why, any of their transgressions have asked me to bear?
sentences.chinese: 但是，为什么，一切的罪过都要我来背负？

sentences.english: Banks found themselves loaded down with non-performing loans.
sentences.chinese: 银行发现自己背负一屁股坏账。

sentences.english: With a bare bodkin? Who would fardels bear.
sentences.chinese: 就能清偿宿债？谁甘心背负重担。

sentences.english: We all have a cross to bear; it could be a heavy load.
sentences.chinese: 我们都背负一个十字架，它或许是一个沉重的负担。

definition: heavy load/heavy burden (also fig. of tax)
to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
wrapping cloth/a bundle wrapped in cloth/load/weight/burden/funny part/punchline
to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
to raise aloft with both hands/(of two or more people) to carry sth together
to carry on one's shoulder/(fig.) to take on (a burden, duty etc)
